newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Shinmoorim Paper in 28-for-100 rights.
newsitem.headline: Shinmoorim Paper in 28-for-100 rights.

text.p: South Korea's Shinmoorim Paper Manufacturing Co Ltd said on Tuesday it would offer a 28-for-100 rights issue in August to raise operating funds and to help finance facilities investment.
The issue will increase the company's paid-in capital to 27 billion won from 20 billion won at present.
Shinmoorim said in a statement that it planned to issue 1.4 million new common shares, of which 20 percent would be allocated to its employees.
The rest would be offered to shareholders as of July 30.
Subscription was set for August 27-28, with payment due by September 11.
The company planned to offer the issue at a 25 percent discount to the base price, which will be decided later.
At 0430 GMT, Shinmoorim shares were traded at 20,900 won, down 100 won on the day before.
